Description: Fragments of a small cylindrical ivory box carved from a section of hippopotamus tusk; the upper and lower edges are decorated with two registers of parallel incised lines, probably produced on a lathe; both base and lid are missing; ivory is cracked in various places; the second fragment is a small break from the main vessel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Material identified by François Popin in April 2007. Compare boxes from BM Enkomi Tomb 47 (1897,4-1.1349) and SCE Tomb 15 (no. 4) (SCE I, pl. LXXXI:6; SCE IV/1D, pp. 554-555 & fig. 74:25) though this example is plainer and lacks the feathered decoration.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 80, Tomb 89 no. 9)
